{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3129650,"name":"Cole Shumaker","username":"c.shu","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T13:40:01.949Z","cooked":"

Since the integrated encoder from Vex Robotics is now discontinued, how are teams putting encoders on their system if they are using these gearboxes? I know I can put something on the output shaft, but I like the idea of getting more resolution on the read by running it on something that makes more revolutions.

For example, I have an arm that is going to turn 0-90 degrees, I’d rather put it on something turning 0-9000 degrees. on a 100:1 reduction.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T13:41:16.126Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":360,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":1844.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"Cole Shumaker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/1","custom_user_title":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3129652,"name":"Abi","username":"thesteminist","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesteminist/{size}/179827_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T13:47:03.896Z","cooked":"

Have you considered using a motor that has an integrated encoder? Falcon 500, NEO, and NEO 550 motors all have them at this point. This would save you from having to mount an entire additional component on your gearbox/motor assembly.

If you are using a 775 series motor like VEX 775 Pro or AndyMark RedLine, the AM Mag Encoder mounts nicely on the back of the motor (so it won’t interfere with your planetary) using the RedLine Encoder Kit.

Even a 1:1 on a rev through bore encoder is 8192 counts per revolution. I don’t think any system in FRC needs that level of precision or is even capable mechanically for it to matter. Also It has a maximum rotation speed of 10k.

If I use a NEO 550, do I need any adapters for the versaplanetary, or does it fit without any add-ons?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:00:20.276Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"Cole Shumaker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48908,"username":"thesteminist","name":"Abi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesteminist/{size}/179827_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/5","custom_user_title":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129668,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T14:06:02.701Z","cooked":"

You shouldn’t have to use any adapters but you may need the right pinion gear. More info can be found here along with some really good advice.

NEO 550 Gearboxes? Motors
Hi everyone, My team recently bought the Neo 550 motors for the shooter, and we realized that the output shaft is thinner than we thought. We don’t know how to mount it to the versa planetary gearboxes. Is there a way to do it? If not which gearboxes did you guys use for it?
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:06:40.147Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/neo-550-gearboxes/372935","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"NEO 550 Gearboxes?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17731,"username":"c.shu","name":"Cole Shumaker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/6","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129674,"name":"Abi","username":"thesteminist","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesteminist/{size}/179827_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T14:16:45.210Z","cooked":"

The VersaPlanetary kit comes with everything you need to use a 550 series motor. There is a 550 mounting plate (the one with the holes the closest together) and then the right size insert for the coupler (also the smallest one). I just linked them in case you are re-using the gearbox or cannot find the tiny little buggers.

I will caution you - make sure you can get the key in the insert to properly hold the coupler on. The set screw alone will NOT hold it on. We had difficulty getting the key in last year, so we ommitted it at first, and experienced issues. I’d recommend grinding the key down little by little until you can get it to fit.

Best of luck!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:21:19.074Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"Abi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-4649.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6},{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-3564.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17731,"username":"c.shu","name":"Cole Shumaker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48908,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 5459 Ipswich TIGERS"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/7","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 5459 Ipswich TIGERS","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129677,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T14:23:48.031Z","cooked":"
c.shu:

For example, I have an arm that is going to turn 0-90 degrees, I’d rather put it on something turning 0-9000 degrees. on a 100:1 reduction.

Consider what sort of backlash you have in the system. Even the best gearboxes have a little play in them, and if you have a final reduction with chain (which is generally recommended for arms), that’s going to add a lot more. It might make more sense to have something like the Rev Throughbore Encoder on the arm axle instead.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:23:48.031Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":100.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/8","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129685,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T14:40:44.106Z","cooked":"

Also, if you’re measuring an arm angle through a gearbox reduction you’re going to need to have a way to zero it. That’s not a concern for a direct measurement with an absolute encoder.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:40:44.106Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":72.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/9","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129692,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T14:52:29.708Z","cooked":"

The Vex encoder was generally the final stage of the gear box so it would be 1:1 to the shaft. I suppose you could put it as the first stage, but would require the programmers to do math. Jon said, the native resolution is enough for FRC (and most other) applications.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:52:29.708Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":131.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423853,"topic_slug":"encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/encoders-on-versaplanetary-gearbox/423853/10","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129702,"name":"Bailey","username":"bkahl","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bkahl/{size}/173222_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T15:09:53.457Z","cooked":"

The VersaPlanetary Integrated Encoder Housing v2 (217-8097) recently was added to the VEX site. It can be found in the VersaPlanetary Configurable Builder on this webpage.

This is an update to the Integrated Encoder housing to allow use of the CANcoder as well as MAG Encoders.

Note: 217-8097 is just the housing - it does not include an encoder.

EDIT:

217-8097 now has its own webpage as well.
